newsitem.title: GERMANY: Glencore buys 10.4 pct of Metaleurop.
newsitem.headline: Glencore buys 10.4 pct of Metaleurop.

text.p: Switzerland's Glencore group has exercised an option to buy a 10.4 percent stake in France's Metaleurop SA from Preussag AG, the German metals and engineering group said in a statement on Thursday.

Commodity trader Glencore has been involved as a strategic partner with Metaleurop since late 1995, and increases its stake through the purchase to 25.4 percent. Preussag holds the same share, but, taking its double voting rights into account, now owns a 40.5 percent voting stake, Preussag said.
Preussag said the transfer of the shares in Metaleurop would take place before a planned capital increase at the French company in March or April.
It added that Preussag and Glencore had agreed to take part in the capital increase in line with their nominal shareholdings.
Terms for Glencore's exercise of the buy option were not disclosed in the statement.

Metaleurop has said it would propose at an extraordinary general meeting on February 28 to halve its nominal capital by reducing the face value of its shares to 25 from 50 francs, then raise its capital by 600 million francs.
